definition: to succeed at the first try (idiom)/easy as pie/one can do it at once
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
to get there in one step (idiom); easily done/success at a stroke/to get results overnight
the first step is the hardest (idiom)
lit. try to straighten out silk threads only to tangle them further (idiom)/fig. to try to help but end up making things worse
to adapt (to an environment etc)/to make sth suitable/adaptation/adjustment/adaptive
to use one's best efforts to do sth (idiom)
variant of 意識形態|意识形态[yi4 shi2 xing2 tai4]
anxious for quick results (idiom); to demand instant success/impatient for result/impetuous
lit. to draw a line on the ground to keep within (idiom)/fig. to impose restrictions on oneself
benchmark/pole serving as mark or symbol/pole with a trophy hung on it
